item.title: Rwanda’s Kabuga says charges are ‘lies’
item.description: Rwandan genocide suspect Felicien Kabuga has called the charges against him "lies" as he appeared before the Paris Court of Appeal.

item.title: Hong Kong anthem bill spurs protests
item.description: Hong Kong police have fired pepper pellets and made 300 arrests as thousands of people took to the streets to voice anger over national security laws proposed by China, that has raised international alarm over freedoms in the city.

item.title: NASA set to resume human spaceflight
item.description: SpaceX, the private rocket company of billionaire entrepreneur Elon Musk, is set to launch two Americans into orbit from Florida on a mission that would mark the first spaceflight of NASA astronauts from US soil in nine years.

item.title: Article weight-shamed me: Mehajer lawyer
item.description: In a claim describing Salim Mehajer as one of Australia's most disliked people, a high-profile defence lawyer says a Sydney gossip column made out she sleeps with clients and unfairly exposed her to ridicule for her manner of dress and weight.

item.title: SpaceX set for debut astronaut mission
item.description: Entrepreneur Elon Musk's SpaceX is set to launch two American astronauts to the International Space Station from NASA's Kennedy Space Center in Florida, ending the US space agency's nine-year hiatus in human spaceflight.

item.title: Italian tenor Andrea Bocelli had virus
item.description: Andrea Bocelli, the world famous Italian tenor, has revealed he tested positive to the novel coronavirus in March but has since recovered fully.

item.title: Woman found dead in home in Vic town
item.description: A woman's death in a town southeast of Melbourne is being investigated by homicide detectives.

item.title: EU urges China to respect HK autonomy
item.description: China must respect Hong Kong's autonomy, the European Union says, amid controversy over Chinese plans to adopt a national security law for the city.

item.title: ‘Virus-free’ Montenegro to open borders
item.description: Montenegro, the first European country to declare itself free of the coronavirus infection, plans to open its borders to citizens of several European countries except for former ally Serbia - drawing angry reaction from Serbian officials.

item.title: Costa Rica allows same-sex marriages
item.description: Costa Rica has given the go-ahead to same-sex marriages, making it the first country in Central America to do so after a landmark court ruling came into effect at midnight.
